member.name: T:ReactiveUI.AutoSuspendHelper
member.summary: Class for helping with Auto Suspending. Auto Suspender helpers will assist with saving out the application state when the application closes or activates.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.AutoSuspendHelper.#ctor(System.Windows.Application)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.AutoSuspendHelper.IdleTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the time out before the Auto Suspension happens.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.DependencyObjectObservableForProperty
member.summary: Creates a observable for a property if available that is based on a DependencyProperty.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.ReactiveWindow`1
member.summary: A that is reactive.

remarks.para: This class is a that is also reactive. That is, it implements . You can extend this class to get an implementation of rather than writing one yourself.

Note that the XAML for your control must specify the same base class, including the generic argument you provide for your view model. To do this, use the TypeArguments attribute as follows:
<rxui:ReactiveWindow x:Class="Foo.Bar.Views.YourView" x:TypeArguments="vms:YourViewModel" xmlns:rxui="http://reactiveui.net" xmlns:vms="clr-namespace:Foo.Bar.ViewModels" xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation" xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml" xmlns:mc="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/markup-compatibility/2006" xmlns:d="http://schemas.microsoft.com/expression/blend/2008" mc:Ignorable="d"> <!-- view XAML here --> </rxui:ReactiveWindow>

member.typeparam: The type of the view model backing the view.

member.name: F:ReactiveUI.ReactiveWindow`1.ViewModelProperty
member.summary: The view model dependency property.

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.ReactiveWindow`1.BindingRoot
member.summary: Gets the binding root view model.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Wpf.Registrations
member.summary: Registrations specific to the WPF platform.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.TransitioningContentControl
member.summary: A ContentControl that animates the transition when its content is changed.

member.name: F:ReactiveUI.TransitioningContentControl.TransitionProperty
member.summary: for the property.

member.name: F:ReactiveUI.TransitioningContentControl.TransitionPartProperty
member.summary: for the property.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.TransitioningContentControl.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: E:ReactiveUI.TransitioningContentControl.TransitionCompleted
member.summary: Occurs when a transition has completed.

member.name: E:ReactiveUI.TransitioningContentControl.TransitionStarted
member.summary: Occurs when a transition has started.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.TransitioningContentControl.TransitionType
member.summary: Represents the type of transition that a TransitioningContentControl will perform.

member.name: F:ReactiveUI.TransitioningContentControl.TransitionType.Fade
member.summary: A simple fading transition.

member.name: F:ReactiveUI.TransitioningContentControl.TransitionType.FadeDown
member.summary: A transition that fades the new element in from the top.

member.name: F:ReactiveUI.TransitioningContentControl.TransitionType.SlideLeft
member.summary: A transition that slides old content left and out of view, then slides new content back in from the same direction.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.TransitioningContentControl.TransitionPartType
member.summary: Represents the part of the transition that the developer would like the TransitioningContentControl to perform.
member.remarks: This only applies to certain TransitionTypes. An InvalidOperationException will be thrown if the TransitionType does not support the TransitionPartType. Default is OutIn.

member.name: F:ReactiveUI.TransitioningContentControl.TransitionPartType.Out
member.summary: Transitions out only.

member.name: F:ReactiveUI.TransitioningContentControl.TransitionPartType.In
member.summary: Transitions in only.

member.name: F:ReactiveUI.TransitioningContentControl.TransitionPartType.OutIn
member.summary: Transitions in and out.

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.TransitioningContentControl.Transition
member.summary: Gets or sets the transition.

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.TransitioningContentControl.TransitionPart
member.summary: Gets or sets the transition part.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.TransitioningContentControl.OnContentChanged(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Called when the value of the property changes.
member.param: The old value of the property.
The new value of the property.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.TransitioningContentControl.AbortTransition
member.summary: Aborts the transition.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.TransitioningContentControl.SetTransitionDefaultValues
member.summary: Sets default values for certain transition types.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.ActivationForViewFetcher
member.summary: ActiveationForViewFetcher is how ReactiveUI determine when a View is activated or deactivated. This is usually only used when porting ReactiveUI to a new UI framework.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.AutoDataTemplateBindingHook
member.summary: AutoDataTemplateBindingHook is a binding hook that checks ItemsControls that don't have DataTemplates, and assigns a default DataTemplate that loads the View associated with each ViewModel.

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.AutoDataTemplateBindingHook.DefaultItemTemplate
member.summary: Gets the default item template.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.BooleanToVisibilityHint
member.summary: Enum that hints at the visibility of a ui element.

member.name: F:ReactiveUI.BooleanToVisibilityHint.None
member.summary: Do not modify the boolean type conversion from it's default action of using the Visibility.Collapsed.

member.name: F:ReactiveUI.BooleanToVisibilityHint.Inverse
member.summary: Inverse the action of the boolean type conversion, when it's true collapse the visibility.

member.name: F:ReactiveUI.BooleanToVisibilityHint.UseHidden
member.summary: Use the hidden version rather than the Collapsed.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.BooleanToVisibilityTypeConverter
member.summary: This type convert converts between Boolean and XAML Visibility - the conversionHint is a BooleanToVisibilityHint.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.PlatformOperations
member.summary: Returns the current orientation of the device on Windows.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.ReactiveUserControl`1
member.summary: A that is reactive.

remarks.para: This class is a that is also reactive. That is, it implements . You can extend this class to get an implementation of rather than writing one yourself.

Note that the XAML for your control must specify the same base class, including the generic argument you provide for your view model. To do this, use the TypeArguments attribute as follows:
<rxui:ReactiveUserControl x:Class="Foo.Bar.Views.YourView" x:TypeArguments="vms:YourViewModel" xmlns:rxui="http://reactiveui.net" xmlns:vms="clr-namespace:Foo.Bar.ViewModels" xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation" xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml" xmlns:mc="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/markup-compatibility/2006" xmlns:d="http://schemas.microsoft.com/expression/blend/2008" mc:Ignorable="d"> <!-- view XAML here --> </rxui:ReactiveUserControl>

member.typeparam: The type of the view model backing the view.

member.summary: The view model dependency property.

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.ReactiveUserControl`1.BindingRoot
member.summary: Gets the binding root view model.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.RoutedViewHost
member.summary: This control hosts the View associated with a Router, and will display the View and wire up the ViewModel whenever a new ViewModel is navigated to. Put this control as the only control in your Window.

member.summary: The router dependency property.

member.summary: The default content property.

member.summary: The view contract observable property.

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.RoutedViewHost.Router
member.summary: Gets or sets the of the view model stack.

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.RoutedViewHost.DefaultContent
member.summary: Gets or sets the content displayed whenever there is no page currently routed.

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.RoutedViewHost.ViewContractObservable
member.summary: Gets or sets the view contract observable.

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.RoutedViewHost.ViewLocator
member.summary: Gets or sets the view locator.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.ViewModelViewHost
member.summary: This content control will automatically load the View associated with the ViewModel property and display it. This control is very useful inside a DataTemplate to display the View associated with a ViewModel.

member.summary: The default content dependency property.

member.summary: Gets or sets the view contract observable.

member.summary: Gets or sets the view contract.

member.summary: Gets or sets the view locator.
